pullRequest.body:
These are essentially wrappers and should not expose any data when made reducible. Their use in constructing typeclass instances makes reducible transparency desirable.

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/bd61b605-d716-4b6e-9f0d-2edb94fd13d9) for commit 8fe3b16d163e4237f5f728f7332ecbee6cdfe350.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/b7d3f697-3d77-48ca-966c-ebbe177937de/to/bd61b605-d716-4b6e-9f0d-2edb94fd13d9) against commit 971aea74163949e6d4a686a3f60c7660d979d269.
please mark as `awaiting-review` if it's ready for more reviews

### PR summary [7735f839a6](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11632/commits/7735f839a6e2c5783b0ede09788049c2da0f8ac6)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instAdd`
`+ instZero`
`+ instance : Neg c.Quotient := AddCon.hasNeg c.toAddCon`
`+ instance : Sub c.Quotient := AddCon.hasSub c.toAddCon`
`- instance : Add c.Quotient := inferInstanceAs (Add c.toAddCon.Quotient)`
`- instance : Mul c.Quotient := inferInstanceAs (Mul c.toCon.Quotient)`
`- instance : Neg c.Quotient := inferInstanceAs (Neg c.toAddCon.Quotient)`
`- instance : Sub c.Quotient := inferInstanceAs (Sub c.toAddCon.Quotient)`
`- instance : Zero c.Quotient := inferInstanceAs (Zero c.toAddCon.Quotient)`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
Coming here from PR triage: can you comment on the status of this PR? Is this meant to get reviewed and landed? If so, please merge master. Thanks!

It's a little unclear whether this is a good idea.

Is this `Quotient` supposed to be a type synonym, or is it meant to have its own instances, separate from the ones on the global `Quotient`?
I am not 100% on it either but I figured that parameters like `(c : Con R)` would keep instances in their own lanes.
On the plus side, this does mean instances for `Quotient` become instances for this `Quotient` too (like `Fintype`, `Finite`, `DecidableEq`, etc.)
Benchmarking indicates we don't have much leakage (if any).
I think this is supposed to just be a shorthand; I don't think there is any reason to give it different instances.
is there any advantage to changing this?
It works. Otherwise it fails with the change. That was the start of the discussion on Zulip

Aside from this change, it's not clear to me that any of the other changes in this file are helpful; at the very least we should delete the comments if we do want the changes, but I'd be inclined to drop the them.

Due to the indexing in the discrimination tree, `RingCon` will reduce to `Con` for the key, never to `AddCon`. Thus, all the instances on `AddCon` are filtered out immediately out on matching. `no_index` isn't really an option because that would make it match too often.

pullRequest.title: chore(Group/RingTheory.Congruence): make `Quotient`'s reducible
